Version 01 Codebook                                                           
-------------------                                                           
CODEBOOK VARIABLE DOCUMENTATION                                               
1988 PRE-POST STUDY                                                           
(1988.TV)                                                                     
                                                                              
                                                                              
                              1988 NES                                        
                          VARIABLE ENTRIES                                    
                                                                              
This file should be opened in fixed font, 10 pitch or smaller.                
Codebook introductory material and appendix material are in                   
separate files.                                                               
----------------------------------------------------------------              
                                                                              
NOTE ON VARIABLE NAMING:                                                      
                                                                              
The variable name references used in NES Study codebooks do not include       
the "V" prefix found in all variable names used within the released           
SAS and SPSS data definition files (.sas and .sps files).                     
                                                                              
For example, "VAR 920001" and "VAR VERSION" in Study codebooks refer to       
V920001 and VVERSION in the study data definition files.                      
                                                                              
                                                                              
VARIABLE 'NUMBERING':                                                         
                                                                              
'Numbered' variables in NES timeseries datasets and in Pilot datasets         
(except the 1998 Pilot) comply with the following format:                     
                                                                              
     2-digit year prefix  +  4 digits  +  [opt] 1-char suffix.                
                                                                              
Examples:  1978 Post variable V780002; 1983 Pilot variable V832101.           
Note that for datasets including data from multiple studies, the 2-digit      
year prefix corresponds to the appropriate study year to which the            
variable is associated; for example, the 1983 Pilot dataset also includes     
1982 timeseries variables, for which the 2-digit prefix is 82.                
                                                                              
Non-time-series studies other than Pilots use 2-character mnemonic            
prefixes, for example variable VPS0048 in the 1988-1990-1992 Pooled           
Senate Study dataset.                                                         
                                                                              
                                                                              
SPECIAL NOTE ON COLUMN LOCATIONS:                                             
                                                                              
Some numeric variables use coding schemes that allow for code values          
having a varying number of digits. In such instances, the number              
of columns corresponding to the variable in the data file [.dat file]         
and in the column specifications  will be the width of the maximum value      
occurring in the actual data, rather than the maximum width allowable         
by the coding scheme.  For example, if codes 01-12 are allowed for a          
numeric variable but all values in the data are less than 10, then the        
number of columns corresponding to the variable within the ASCII data         
                                                                              
==============================                                                
VAR VERSION   NAME- NES VERSION NUMBER                                        
              COLUMNS  1   -  2                                               
              NUMERIC                                                         
              NO MISSING DATA CODES                                           
                                                                              
                 NES VERSION NUMBER                                           
                 ..................

              COLUMNS  3   -  9                                               
              CHARACTER                                                       
              NO MISSING DATA CODES                                           
                                                                              
                 NES DATASET NUMBER                                           
                 ..................                                           
                                                                              
                 This is dataset 1988.TV

                SELECTION. SEE SAMPLING INFORMATION IN THE INTRODUCTION.

VAR 880014    NAME-  TRACT/ED INDICATOR                                       
              COLUMNS 57   - 57                                               
              NUMERIC                                                         
              NO MISSING DATA CODES                                           
                                                                              
                TRACT/ED INDICATOR                                            
                ------------------                                            
                                                                              
              1784  1.  SAMPLE ADDRESS IS IN A TRACTED AND BLOCKED AREA

VAR 880020    NAME-  SIZE PLACE INTERVIEW                                     
              COLUMNS 79   - 80                                               
              NUMERIC                                                         
              NO MISSING DATA CODES                                           
                                                                              
                SIZE OF PLACE OF INTERVIEW                                    
                --------------------------                                    
                                                                              
                THIS VARIABLE WAS CODED ACCORDING TO THE 1980 CENSUS. THE     
                MAJOR OBJECTIVE OF THE CENSUS BUREAU IN DELINEATING           
                URBANIZED AREAS IS TO PROVIDE A BETTER SEPARATION OF URBAN    
                AND RURAL POPULATION IN THE VICINITY OF LARGE CITIES.  AN     
                URBANIZED AREA CONSISTS OF A CENTRAL CITY OR CITIES, AND      
                SURROUNDING CLOSELY SETTLED TERRITORY ("URBAN FRINGE"). SIZE  
                OF PLACE CODES 21 AND 41 INCLUDE AREAS THAT ARE IN THE        
                "URBAN FRINGE" BUT ARE NOT CENSUS PLACES.                     
                                                                              
                SEE INTRODUCTION: SAMPLING INFORMATION                        
                                                                              
                SEE APPENDIX NOTE                                             
                                                                              
                SIX LARGEST SCSA'S (OVER 4,000,000 POP) AND FIVE OUT OF TEN   
                NEXT LARGEST SMSA'S (2,000,000 POP)                           
                                                                              
               176  11.  CENTRAL CITIES                                       
                                                                              
                SUBURBS OF SIX LARGEST SCSA'S AND FIVE OUT OF THE TEN NEXT    
                LARGEST NEXT LARGEST SMSA'S.                                  
                                                                              
                25  20.  RURAL (INCLUDING RURAL PLACES WITH LESS THAN 2500    
                         POPULATION)                                          
                61  21.  2,500-9,999 PLUS OTHER URBANIZED AREAS ("URBAN       
                         FRINGE" NOT IN CENSUS PLACES)                        
               102  22.  10,000-29,999                                        
                49  23.  30,000-49,999                                        
               101  24.  50,000-99,999                                        
                 5  25.  100,000-149,999                                      
                    26.  150,000-349,999                                      
                    27.  350,000 AND OVER, EXCLUSIVE OF CITIES CODED 11       
                                                                              
                SMSA'S WITH LESS THAN 2,000,000 POPULATION, EXCLUSIVE OF      
                THOSE IN THE SIX LARGEST SCSA'S                               
                                                                              
                CENTRAL CITIES IN SMSA'S WITH LESS THAN 2,000,000 POPULATION  
                                                                              
                35  30.  UNDER 50,000 (IDENTIFIED BY CENSUS BUREAU AS         
                         CENTRAL CITIES)                                      
                30  31.  50,000-99,999                                        
                34  32.  100,000-149,999                                      
               157  33.  150,000-349,999                                      
                62  34.  350,000 AND OVER                                     
                                                                              
                SUBURBS IN SMSA'S WITH LESS THAN 2,000,000 POPULATION

VAR 880022    NAME-  BELT CODE                                                
              COLUMNS 85   - 85                                               
              NUMERIC                                                         
              NO MISSING DATA CODES                                           
                                                                              
                BELT CODE (1980 CENSUS)                                       
                -----------------------                                       
                                                                              
                THIS VARIABLE WAS CODED ACCORDING TO THE 1980 CENSUS WITH     
                ADDITIONS FROM CENSUS POPULATION REPORTS.  SUBURBS ARE        
                DEFINED AS ALL URBANIZED AREAS IN THE SMSA EXCLUSIVE OF THE   
                AREAS CODED "1" AND "2" BELOW, PLUS THE REMAINDER OF ANY      
                COUNTY WHICH INCLUDES A CENTRAL CITY OR PARTS OF A CENTRAL    
                CITY.  (NOTE: IN THE NEW ENGLAND DIVISION WHERE SMSA          
                BOUNDARIES DO NOT FOLLOW COUNTY LINES, IT IS NECESSARY TO     
                LIMIT THIS CATEGORY TO THE SMSA PART OF A COUNTY WHICH        
                INCLUDES A CENTRAL CITY.)  AN ADJACENT AREA INCLUDES ALL      
                TERRITORY BEYOND THE OUTER BOUNDARY OF THE SUBURBAN BELT,     
                BUT WITHIN FIFTY MILES OF THE CENTRAL BUSINESS DISTRICT OF A  
                CENTRAL CITY. AN OUTLYING AREA INCLUDES ALL TERRITORY MORE    
                THAN FIFTY MILES FROM THE CENTRAL BUSINESS DISTRICT OF A      
                CENTRAL CITY.                                                 
                                                                              
                SEE INTRODUCTION: SAMPLING INFORMATION                        
                                                                              
                SEE APPENDIX NOTE                                             
                                                                              
               176  1.  CENTRAL CITIES OF THE SIX LARGEST STANDARD            
                        CONSOLIDATED STATISTICAL AREAS (SCSA'S) PLUS FIVE     
                        OUT OF THE TEN NEXT LARGEST SMSA'S (POPULATION OVER   
                        2,000,000)                                            
               318  2.  CENTRAL CITIES OF SMSA'S WITH LESS THAN 2,000,000     
                        POPULATION (EXCLUSIVE OF THOSE IN THE 6 LARGEST       
                        SCSA'S)                                               
               353  3.  SUBURBS OF THE 6 LARGEST SCSA'S, AND OF FIVE OUT OF   
                        THE TEN NEXT LARGEST SMSA'S                           
               510  4.  SUBURBS OF OTHER SMSA'S                               
               518  5.  ADJACENT AREAS                                        
               165  6.  OUTLYING AREAS                                        
                                                                              
==============================

VAR 880025    NAME-  SELECTION TABLE                                          
              COLUMNS 92   - 93                                               
              NUMERIC                                                         
              NO MISSING DATA CODES                                           
                                                                              
                SELECTION TABLE                                               
                ---------------                                               
                                                                              
                THE SELECTION TABLE IS USED TO SELECT A RESPONDENT FROM ALL   
                ELIGIBLE ADULTS (18 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER BY ELECTION DAY     
                AND U.S. CITIZENS) IN A HOUSEHOLD. A COMPLETE LISTING OF THE  
                HOUSEHOLD IS TAKEN AND EACH ELIGIBLE ADULT IS ASSIGNED A      
                NUMBER BASED ON THE CRITERIA OF SEX AND AGE.  THE             
                INTERVIEWER THEN USES THE SELECTION TABLE TO DETERMINE THE    
                NUMBER OF THE ELIGIBLE ADULT TO BE INTERVIEWED. THE           
                SELECTION TABLE CONSISTS OF TWO PARALLEL COLUMNS OF NUMBERS.  
                IN THE FIRST COLUMN THE INTERVIEWER CIRCLES THE TOTAL NUMBER  
                OF ELIGIBLE ADULTS IN THE HOUSEHOLD; IN THE SECOND COLUMN     
                THERE IS A NUMBER WHICH IDENTIFIES (I.E., MATCHES THE NUMBER  
                ASSIGNED TO ONE OF THE ELIGIBLE ADULTS) THE RESPONDENT.       
                                                                              
                THERE ARE EIGHT DIFFERENT SELECTION TABLES USED AND THEY ARE  
                RANDOMLY ASSIGNED.  THE SELECTION TABLE APPEARS ON THE        
                COVERSHEET BELOW THE HOUSEHOLD LISTING.                       
               192  01.  A                                                    
               160  02.  B1                                                   
               188  03.  C                                                    
               179  04.  D                                                    
               169  05.  E1                                                   
               181  06.  F                                                    
               159  07.  A                                                    
               167  08.  B2                                                   
               147  09.  C                                                    
               164  10.  D                                                    
               187  11.  E2                                                   
               147  12.  F                                                    
                                                                              
==============================

VAR 880096    NAME-  HOUSEHOLD COMPOSITION                                    
              COLUMNS 202  - 203                                              
              NUMERIC                                                         
              MD=0 OR GE  99                                                  
                                                                              
                HOUSEHOLD COMPOSITION                                         
                ---------------------                                         
                                                                              
                BELOW, HOUSEHOLDER REFERS TO THE PERSON WHO OWNS OR RENTS     
                THE HOME; IN WHOSE NAME THE LEASE IS HELD. COHABITING         
                INDIVIDUALS LIVING AS MARRIED ARE CODED AS MARRIED            
                (30,40,50,51,52).  FOR ROOMMATES OF OPPOSITE SEX, RESPONDENT  
                IS CONSIDERED THE HEAD/HOUSEHOLDER (11,12,21,22).             
                                                                              
               206  10.  ONE ADULT MALE                                       
                23  11.  ONE ADULT MALE (HEAD/HOUSEHOLDER) PLUS ONE OTHER     
                         NON-RELATIVE                                         
                 4  12.  ONE ADULT MALE (HEAD/HOUSEHOLDER) PLUS TWO OR MORE   
                         OTHER NON-RELATIVES                                  
               425  20.  ONE ADULT FEMALE                                     
                16  21.  ONE ADULT FEMALE (HEAD/HOUSEHOLDER) PLUS ONE OTHER   
                         NON-RELATIVE                                         
                 9  22.  ONE ADULT FEMALE (HEAD/HOUSEHOLDER) PLUS TWO OR      
                         MORE OTHER NON-RELATIVES                             
               976  30.  ONE MARRIED COUPLE--ALL CHILDREN LIVING AT HOME ARE  
                         UNDER 18, OR NO CHILDREN                             
               169  40.  ONE MARRIED PLUS ONE OTHER RELATIVE                  
                63  50.  ONE MARRIED PLUS TWO OR MORE OTHER RELATIVES         
                 3  51.  ONE MARRIED PLUS ONE OTHER NON-RELATIVE              
                 1  52.  ONE MARRIED PLUS TWO OR MORE OTHER NON-RELATIVES     
                16  60.  AN UNMARRIED MALE (HEAD/HOUSEHOLDER) PLUS ONE OTHER  
                         RELATIVE                                             
                 6  70.  AN UNMARRIED MALE (HEAD/HOUSEHOLDER) PLUS TWO OR     
                         MORE OTHER RELATIVES                                 
                85  80.  AN UNMARRIED FEMALE (HEAD/HOUSEHOLDER) PLUS ONE      
                         OTHER RELATIVE                                       
                29  90.  AN UNMARRIED FEMALE (HEAD/HOUSEHOLDER) PLUS TWO OR   
                         MORE OTHER RELATIVES                                 
                 8  95.  RELATIVES OF OPPOSITE SEX, UNCLEAR WHO IS HEAD OR    
                         HOUSEHOLDER                                          
                                                                              
                 1  99.  NA                                                   
                    00.  INAP, NOT AN OCCUPIED HOUSEHOLD UNIT

              NUMERIC                                                         
              MD=997 OR GE  998                                               
                                                                              
                Q.D4.  I'D LIKE TO GET YOUR FEELINGS TOWARD SOME OF OUR       
                POLITICAL LEADERS AND OTHER PEOPLE WHO ARE IN THE NEWS THESE  
                DAYS. I'LL READ THE NAME OF A PERSON AND I'D LIKE YOU TO      
                RATE THAT PERSON USING SOMETHING WE CALL THE FEELING          
                THERMOMETER. RATINGS BETWEEN 50 DEGREES AND 100 DEGREES MEAN  
                THAT YOU FEEL FAVORABLE AND WARM TOWARD THE PERSON. RATINGS   
                BETWEEN 0 DEGREES AND 50 DEGREES MEAN THAT YOU DON'T FEEL     
                FAVORABLE TOWARD THE PERSON AND THAT YOU DON'T CARE TOO MUCH  
                FOR FOR THAT PERSON. YOU WOULD RATE THE PERSON AT THE 50      
                DEGREE MARK IF YOU DON'T FEEL PARTICULARLY WARM OR COLD       
                TOWARD THE PERSON. IF WE COME TO A PERSON WHOSE NAME YOU      
                DON'T RECOGNIZE, YOU DON'T NEED TO RATE THAT PERSON. JUST     
                TELL ME AND WE'LL MOVE ON TO THE NEXT ONE. OUR FIRST PERSON   
                IS ROBERT DOLE. (USE SAME CODE FOR V153-V163) HOW WOULD YOU   
                RATE HIM USING THE THERMOMETER?                               
                                                                              
                Q.D4A.  ROBERT DOLE <FEELING THERMOMETER>

              NUMERIC                                                         
              MD=98 OR GE  99                                                 
                                                                              
                Q.H8.  IN ORDER TO REDUCE THE SIZE OF THE FEDERAL BUDGET      
                DEFICIT ARE YOU WILLING OR NOT WILLING TO PAY MORE IN         
                FEDERAL TAXES? (IF 2 OR 4 MARKED BUT NO QUALIFICATION IS      
                GIVEN, CODE 10 OR 50)                                         
                --------------------------------------------------------      
                                                                              
                    10.  WILLING                                              
                    50.  NOT WILLING                                          
                                                                              
                    98.  DK                                                   
                    99.  NA                                                   
                                                                              
                IF QUALIFICATIONS GIVEN:                                      
                                                                              
                1ST DIGIT:  SCALE CATEGORY MARKED IN INTERVIEW                
                                                                              
                 2   WILLING, BUT:                                            
                 4   NOT WILLING UNLESS                                       
                                                                              
                2ND DIGIT:  CONTENT OF QUALIFICATION                          
                                                                              
                 1   (IF/UNLESS) IT WILL REALLY REDUCE THE DEFICIT; IS        
                     USED ONLY TO REDUCE THE DEFICIT (AND NOT SPENT ON        
                     OTHER PROGRAMS)                                          
                 2   (IF/UNLESS) EVERYONE HAS THEIR TAXES RAISED (BY          
                     THE SAME AMOUNT); EVERYONE PAYS THEIR (FAIR) SHARE       
                 3   (IF/UNLESS) IT IS ONLY A SMALL INCREASE; THE             
                     INCREASE IS AN AMOUNT I COULD AFFORD TO PAY              
                 4   (ONLY IF/NOT UNLESS) SPENDING IS CUT FIRST;              
                     UNNECESSARY PROGRAMS ARE ELIMINATED FIRST; WASTE         
                     IN GOVERNMENT SPENDING IS STOPPED FIRST--R DOES          
                     NOT SPECIFY WHICH PROGRAMS SHOULD BE CUT OR              
                     ELIMINATED                                               
                 5   (ONLY IF/NOT UNLESS) SPECIFIC PROGRAMS ARE               
                     CUT/ELIMINATED FIRST; WASTE IN SPECIFIC PROGRAMS         
                     IS STOPPED--R SPECIFIES PROGRAMS TO BE CUT OR            
                     ELIMINATED (DEFENSE, WELFARE, FOREIGN AID, ETC.)         
                 6   (ONLY IF/NOT UNLESS) I KNOW BEFOREHAND WHAT THE          
                     MONEY IS GOING TO BE SPENT ON; THE MONEY IS SPENT        
                     ON PROGRAMS/FOR PURPOSES OF WHICH I APPROVE              
                 9   OTHER SPECIFIC MENTION...(MAKE CARD)

                (NOTE:  Q.Y4 AND Q.Y22 NEED TO BE CODED WITH A 2-DIGIT CODE   
                WHICH WILL ALLOW US TO CLASSIFY A RETIRED/PERMANENTLY         
                DISABLED/HOUSEWIFE/STUDENT WHO IS ALSO WORKING NOW,           
                DIFFERENTIATED AS TO WHETHER THE EMPLOYMENT IS HALF-TIME OR   
                MORE, OR LESS THAN HALF-TIME. TO DETERMINE THIS YOU WILL      
                HAVE TO SCAN THE ENTIRE EMPLOYMENT SECTION FOR R              
                (Q.Y4-Q.Y20A) TO DETERMINE IF R HAS INFORMATION IN MORE THAN  
                ONE EMPLOYMENT CATEGORY. IF SO, YOU WILL THEN NEED TO         
                DETERMINE THE NUMBER OF HOURS WORKED AT THE CURRENT JOB       
                (Q.Y7) AND ASSIGN R TO THE COMBINATION CATEGORY (E.G.,        
                WORKING NOW AND STUDENT) DEPENDING ON WHETHER THEY WORK 20    
                HRS+ OR LESS. THIS IS DONE FOR ALL RESPONDENTS. IF R IS       
                WORKING NOW ONLY ASSIGN CODE 10 REGARDLESS OF NUMBER OF       
                HOURS WORKED IN Q.Y7. CODE NUMBER PRE-CODED IN GREEN.)

                THIS VARIABLE IS THE RECODING OF THE L980 U.S. CENSUS BUREAU  
                OCCUPATION CODE, WHICH WAS ORIGINALLY CODED HERE.  THIS       
                RECODED VERSION CONSISTS OF THE 71 OCCUPATION CODE HEADINGS.  
                                                                              
                THIS VARIABLE COMBINES DATA FROM ALL R'S WHO ARE CURRENTLY    
                EMPLOYED, TEMPORARILY LAID OFF, UNEMPLOYED, RETIRED, OR       
                PERMANENTLY DISABLED.  EXCLUDED ARE THOSE WHO ARE HOMEMAKERS  
                OR STUDENTS WITHOUT OUTSIDE EMPLOYMENT. IF RESPONDENT WAS     
                CODED 15 OR 51 (WORKING NOW AND RETIRED) IN Q.Y4, HIS/HER     
                FORMER OCCUPATION INFORMATION WAS USED.

                WILL ALLOW US TO CLASSIFY A RETIRED/PERMANENTLY               
                DISABLED/HOMEMAKER/STUDENT WHO IS ALSO WORKING NOW,           
                DIFFERENTIATED AS TO WHETHER THE EMPLOYMENT IS HALF-TIME OR   
                MORE, OR LESS THAN HALF-TIME. TO DETERMINE THIS YOU WILL      
                HAVE TO SCAN THE ENTIRE EMPLOYMENT SECTION FOR                
                HUSBAND/PARTNER (Q.Y22-Q.Y37A) TO DETERMINE IF HE HAS         
                INFORMATION IN MORE THAN ONE EMPLOYMENT CATEGORY. IF SO, YOU  
                WILL THEN NEED TO DETERMINE THE NUMBER OF HOURS WORKED AT     
                THE CURRENT JOB (Q.Y25) AND ASSIGN HUSBAND/ PARTNER TO THE    
                COMBINATION CATEGORY (E.G., WORKING NOW AND STUDENT)          
                DEPENDING ON WHETHER THEY WORK 20 HRS+ OR LESS. THIS IS DONE  
                FOR ALL HUSBANDS/PARTNERS. IF HE IS WORKING NOW ONLY ASSIGN

                HOMEMAKERS OR STUDENTS WITHOUT OUTSIDE EMPLOYMENT, AND THOSE  
                WHO ARE RETIRED AND WORKING FOR PAY AT THE PRESENT TIME.

              COLUMNS 945  - 947                                              
              NUMERIC                                                         
              MD=888 OR GE  997                                               
                                                                              
                Q.B1. (R.B., P.1)  PLEASE TURN TO PAGE ONE OF THIS BOOKLET.   
                I'D LIKE TO GET YOUR FEELINGS TOWARD SOME OF OUR POLITICAL    
                LEADERS AND OTHER PEOPLE WHO ARE IN THE NEWS THESE DAYS.      
                I'LL READ THE NAME OF A PERSON AND I'D LIKE YOU TO RATE THAT  
                PERSON USING SOMETHING WE CALL THE FEELING THERMOMETER.       
                RATINGS BETWEEN 50 DEGREES AND 100 DEGREES MEAN THAT YOU      
                FEEL FAVORABLE AND WARM TOWARD THAT PERSON.                   
                                                                              
                RATINGS BETWEEN 0 DEGREES AND 50 DEGREES MEAN THAT YOU DON'T  
                FEEL FAVORABLE TOWARD THE PERSON AND THAT YOU DON'T CARE TOO  
                MUCH FOR THAT PERSON. YOU WOULD RATE THE PERSON AT THE 50     
                DEGREE MARK IF YOU DON'T FEEL PARTICULARLY WARM OR COLD       
                TOWARD THE PERSON. IF WE COME TO A PERSON WHOSE NAME YOU      
                DON'T RECOGNIZE, YOU DON'T NEED TO RATE THAT PERSON.  JUST    
                TELL ME AND WE'LL MOVE ON TO THE NEXT ONE.                    
                                                                              
                Q.B1A.  OUR FIRST PERSON IS GEORGE BUSH.  HOW WOULD YOU RATE  
                HIM USING THE FEELING THERMOMETER? (USE SAME CODE FOR         
                V593-603)                                                     
                ------------------------------------------------------------  
                                                                              
                CODE ACTUAL NUMBER                                            
                                                                              
                    000.                                                      
                          .                                                   
                          .                                                   
                    100.

VAR 880899    NAME-  K1. (A-POST)/Q1. (B-PRE)                                 
              COLUMNS 1426 - 1426                                             
              NUMERIC                                                         
              MD=7 OR GE  8                                                   
                                                                              
                -- FOR R'S ADMINISTERED FORM B, QUESTIONS CONTAINED IN VAR.   
                899-923 WERE ASKED IN THE PRE-ELECTION SURVEY, SECTION Q.     
                FOR R'S ADMINISTERED FORM A, QUESTIONS CONTAINED IN VAR.      
                899-923 WERE ASKED IN POST-ELECTION SURVEY, SECTION K. IF     
                DISAGREGATION BY FORM IS DESIRED, V40 SHOULD BE USED. SEE     
                INTRODUCTION: SURVEY ADMINISTRATION, P. V-VI, VIII FOR        
                FURTHER INFORMATION --                                        
                                                                              
                RONALD REAGAN WAS ELECTED PRESIDENT IN NOVEMBER 1980 AND      
                TOOK OFFICE IN JANUARY 1981. HE WILL SOON BE LEAVING OFFICE   
                AFTER EIGHT YEARS AS PRESIDENT. DURING THESE EIGHT YEARS,     
                SOME FEDERAL PROGRAMS HAVE INCREASED, SOME HAVE DECREASED,    
                AND OTHERS HAVE REMAINED ABOUT THE SAME.                      
                                                                              
                Q.Q1/K1.  HAVE FEDERAL EFFORTS TO IMPROVE AND PROTECT THE     
                ENVIRONMENT INCREASED, DECREASED, OR STAYED ABOUT THE SAME    
                AS THEY WERE IN 1980, OR HAVEN'T YOU PAID MUCH ATTENTION?     
                -----------------------------------------------------------   
                                                                              
               460  1.  INCREASED...(7 IN V901-902)                           
               532  3.  STAYED ABOUT THE SAME...(7 IN V900,902)               
               400  5.  DECREASED...(7 IN V900-901)                           
                                                                              
               129  7.  INAP, NO POST INTERVIEW AND 1, 4 IN V40               
                17  8.  DK...(7 IN V900-902)                                  
                11  9.  NA...(7 IN V900-902)                                  
               491  0.  NOT MUCH ATTENTION...(7 IN V900-902)                  
                                                                              
==============================

                REGISTRATION RECORDS>.  (CODE 3 MENTIONS)

                ------------------------------------------------------        
                                                                              
                ADDRESS CHECK CONFINED TO SPECIFIC INDIVIDUALS                
                                                                              
                 7  10.  SAMPLE BALLOTS CLASSIFIED AS UNDELIVERABLE BY P.O.

                    17.  INVESTIGATE SPECIFIC COMPLAINTS

                ACROSS THE BOARD ADDRESS CHECK                                
                                                                              
                96  30.  MAIL CHECK--DO NOT FORWARD CARD/LETTER IS SENT TO    
                         EVERYONE IN THE CITY OR COUNTY

VAR 881188    NAME-  13. ANY REG/VOTE FILE?                                   
              COLUMNS 1786 - 1786                                             
              NUMERIC                                                         
              MD=0 OR GE  8                                                   
                                                                              
                1988 VOTE VALIDATION ELECTION ADMINISTRATION                  
                                                                              
                --NOTE:  VOTE INFORMATION IS STORED BY ELECTIONS OFFICERS IN  
                BASICALLY TWO DIFFERENT WAYS:  IT IS EITHER INCORPORATED      
                INTO THE VOTER'S REGISTRATION RECORD, OR IT IS KEPT ENTIRELY  
                SEPARATE FROM IT.  THE TWO PROCEDURES ARE ENTIRELY            
                DIFFERENT; THE SECOND ONE IS DESCRIBED IN QS. 20-27.  IN THE  
                FIRST PROCEDURE THE VOTE INFORMATION IS SOMETIMES ENTERED     
                INTO THE REGISTRATION MASTER FILE AS DESCRIBED IN QS. 7-14;   
                OR IT IS TRANSCRIBED INTO THE REGISTRATION CARDS THEMSELVES   
                DESCRIBED IN QS. 14-19.  SINCE BOTH PROCEDURES ARE            
                EQUIVALENT, THE TWO SETS OF QUESTIONS ARE CODED IN THE SAME   
                VARIABLES 1189-1197.  Q. 13 IS CODED ONLY WHEN QS. 14-17 ARE  
                ANSWERED--                                                    
                                                                              
                EA.13.  IS THERE ANY VERSION OR SET OF REGISTRATION RECORDS   
                WHERE INFORMATION ABOUT A PERSON'S VOTING PARTICIPATION ALSO  
                APPEARS?                                                      
                ------------------------------------------------------------  
                                                                              
                23  1.  YES                                                   
                    5.  NO...(0 IN 1189-1197)                                 
                                                                              
                    8.  DK...(0 IN 1189-1197)                                 
                53  9.  NA...(0 IN 1189-1197)                                 
              1964  0.  INAP, 1 IN 1173 AND 1 IN 1187; 2 IN 1187

                1988 VOTE VALIDATION ELECTION ADMINISTRATION                  
                                                                              
                NOW WE WANT TO TALK A LITTLE BIT ABOUT THE WAY THE OFFICE IS  
                STAFFED TO HANDLE REGISTRATION -- SOME OF THE RULES AND       
                REGULATIONS THAT APPLY AT THIS LOCATION.

                (CODE 3 MENTIONS)                                             
                                                                              
                EA.37B(1)  <FIRST MENTION>                                    
                ---------------------------------------------------------     
                    10.  NO QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED/ALL APPLICANTS ACCEPTED   
               184  11.  ATTEND A TRAINING CLASS OR PROGRAM                   
                88  12.  PASS A TEST                                          
                30  13.  TAKE AN OATH/SIGN AN AFFIDAVIT                       
                55  14.  BE AT LEAST 18 YEARS OLD                             
               123  15.  BE A COUNTY RESIDENT/CITY RESIDENT/DISTRICT          
                         RESIDENT                                             
               312  16.  BE REGISTERED TO VOTE                                
                99  17.  BE AN AMERICAN CITIZEN                               
                 6  18.  BE ABLE TO READ AND WRITE                            
                    19.  MUST NOT BE A CONVICTED FELON                        
                                                                              
                    20.  MUST BE NON-PARTISAN                                 
                14  21.  MUST BE A PERSON OF INTEGRITY                        
               163  22.  MUST BE SPONSORED OR RECOMMENDED BY A POLITICAL      
                         PARTY OR POLITICAL OFFICIAL                          
               125  23.  MUST BE HIRED BY A PERMANENT REGISTRATION SITE       
                70  24.  MUST BE A MEMBER OF AN ORGANIZATION HAVING A         
                         REGISTRATION DRIVE                                   
               115  25.  MUST BE APPOINTED BY THE ELECTION COMMISSION         
               159  26.  MUST BE APPOINTED/APPROVED BY THE REGISTRAR, THE     
                         CITY/ TOWNSHIP CLERK, SELECTMEN, THE STATE           
                52  27.  MUST BE A CITY OR COUNTY CLERK                       
                 1  28.  BY BEING MARRIED TO THE REGISTRAR/CLERK              
                 3  29.  BY BEING A HIGH SCHOOL PRINCIPAL/SCHOOL SECRETARY    
                                                                              
                    30.  MUST BE ELECTED                                      
                84  31.  MUST BE SPONSORED OR RECOMMENDED BY A CIVIC/LABOR

VAR 881268    NAME-  37d. MENTION 1                                           
              COLUMNS 1912 - 1913                                             
              NUMERIC                                                         
              MD=0 OR GE  98                                                  
                                                                              
                1988 VOTE VALIDATION ELECTION ADMINISTRATION                  
                                                                              
                EA.37D.  WHAT ARE THEY? <LIMITS ON THE NUMBER OF DEPUTY       
                REGISTRARS> (CODE 2 MENTIONS)                                 
                                                                              
                EA.37D(1) <FIRST MENTION>                                     
                -------------------------------------------------------       
                                                                              
                    10.  NO LIMITATIONS ON NUMBER OF REGISTRARS--NFS          
                32  11.  NO LIMITATIONS ON VOLUNTEERS BUT BUDGETARY           
                         LIMITATIONS FOR PAID ONES                            
                20  12.  NUMBER SET BY ELECTION BOARD                         
                18  13.  NUMBER SET BY CITY OR COUNTY CLERK                   
                27  14.  THERE IS A SET NUMBER FOR EACH PRECINCT OR SECTION   
                84  15.  THERE IS A SET NUMBER FOR EACH PRECINCT PER PARTY    
                27  16.  MUST BALANCE NUMBER OF DEMOCRATS AND REPUBLICANS AT  
                         TEMPORARY SITES                                      
                    17.  THEY MUST BE ELECTED                                 
                    18.  THERE IS A SET NUMBER FOR EACH CITY UNDER THE        
                         OFFICER'S JURISDICTION                               
               114  19.  THERE IS A SET NUMBER PER ORGANIZATION/CLUB

NOTE FOR THE FOLLOWING VARIABLES (V882000-V882149):                           
                                                                              
THESE VARIABLES ARE FOR THE 1991 RE-VALIDATION OF 1988 RESPONDENTS.           
                                                                              
This documentation has been converted to electronic format via OCR            
scanning.  As as result, the user is advised that some errors in character    
recognition may have resulted within the text.                                
                                                                              
REVALIDATION VARIABLES V882003-V882046 - INDIVIDUAL VOTER RECORD FORM VARS.   
REVALIDATION VARIABLES V882103-V882149 - DESCRIBE VALIDATION PROCESS          
                                                                              
        Individual Voter Record Vars                                          
        ----------------------------                                          
                                                                              
    V882000-882005       Pre-Post and Filter/ID Vars                          
    V882006-882031       Location and Verification of Registration            
    V882032-882042       Did R Vote? (Using registration record)              
    V882043-882046       Did R Vote? (Not on registration record)             
                                                                              
        Revalidation Process Description Vars                                 
        -------------------------------------                                 
                                                                              
    V882103-882107       Task Summary Vars                                    
    V882108-882110       Search for Registration Records                      
    V882115-882123       Master Registration File                             
    V882124-882149       Interviewer Use of Sources                           
                                                                              
                                                                              
==============================

==============================                                                
VAR 882001                                                                    
              COLUMNS 1971 - 1971                                             
              NUMERIC                                                         
                                                                              
              1988. Does the respondent have a registration record in this    
                   office?                                                    
                                                                              
     SEE 1988 VALIDATION VARIABLE V881118                                     
                                                                              
     1.   Yes                                                                 
     2.   No                                                                  
                                                                              
     9.   Is registered out of area, registration mistakenly checked at office
          of sample location                                                  
                                                                              
     0.   Not validated                                                       
                                                                              
==============================                                                
VAR 882002                                                                    
                                                                              
    1988 Record of R Voting                                                   
                                                                              
     SEE 1988 VALIDATION VARIABLE V881148                                     
                                                                              
     1.   Registration/voting record for R found and it indicates that R voted
     2.   There is a registration record for R, but R is not listed as having 
          voted                                                               
     4.   Registration record active (also 1 case registration record inactive
          and 1 case NA status of registration record), no voting record for  
          R, some voting records unavailable                                  
          No registration record found for R in this office (if voting records
          are kept independently in this office, this also implies that there 
          is no record of R in the voting records)                            
                                                                              
     7.   No name: records not checked                                        
     8.   DK, NA if voted; no voting record available in office; office       
          refused; registered out of area                                     
     9.   R's self report is not registered or DK/NA if registered: records   
          not checked                                                         
                                                                              
==============================                                                
VAR 882002A                                                                   
              COLUMNS 1973 - 1973                                             
              NUMERIC                                                         
                                                                              
              1988 R Voted recoded                                            
                                                                              
    BASED ON V882001, V882002                                                 
                                                                              
     1.   R was registered and voted (1 in V882002)                           
     2.   R was registered and did not vote (2, 4 in V882002)                 
     5.   No registration or vote record found for R (5 in V882002)           
                                                                              
     8.   R registered, vote record not available (1 in V882001 and 8 in      
          V882002)                                                            
     9.   Registered out of area, registration must actually be checked at    
          sample location (9 in V882001)                                      
     0.   Not validated. Not registered (0 in V882001), R refused name        
          (7 in V882002); R registered out of area (8 in V882002)             
                                                                              
==============================                                                
VAR 882003                                                                    
              COLUMNS 1974 - 1974                                             
              NUMERIC                                                         
                                                                              
              1991 Revalidation filter variable                               
                                                                              
    REVALIDATION OF 1988 VOTE -                                                
     
    INDIVIDUAL VOTER RECORD FORM                                              
                                                                              
     This variable can be used to access cases for whom (a record check was   
     done) both in 1991 and 1989 (code 1), those for whom a check             
     was done only in 1989 (codes 1, 4) or those who were revalidated in 1991 
     (codes 1, 2).                                                            
                                                                              
     1.   Record check done both in 1988 and 1991                             
     2.   Record check not done in 1989 but was done in 1991                  
     3.   Record check not done in either 1989 or 1991                        
     4.   Cases not revalidated in 1991. Offices 1, 5, 8, 12, 16, 23, 53, 57  
          and 76. Cases 938, 1261, 1476 in V880048 were lost                  
     5.   Not validated in 1989 or 1991, self-report not registered           
                                                                              
==============================

    REVALIDATION OF 1988 VOTE -                                                
    INDIVIDUAL VOTER RECORD FORM                                              
                                                                              
     This is the election office where R told us he/she was registered. For   
     not-registered (not validated) respondents, this office corresponds to   
     the one appropriate for their sample address.                            
                                                                              
     999. R registered out of sample and record check done over the phone

VAR 882032                                                                    
              COLUMNS 2024 - 2024                                             
              NUMERIC                                                         
                                                                              
              BO. CHECKPOINT                                                  
                                                                              
                                                                              
    REVALIDATION OF 1988 VOTE -                                               
    INDIVIDUAL VOTER RECORD FORM                                              
                                                                              
This checkpoint was originally intended to design a search process based      
on the way offices organize their registration and vote records. If the office
had a Registration Master file (computerized or manual) containing vote       
information, the interviewers were supposed to mark 4 and proceed to look up  
the respondent on that file. Original sources were supposed to be searched    
only if the interviewer did not find evidence of R voting in the Master file. 
If the office kept registration and vote records separately, the interviewer  
was supposed to mark 1 and work directly with whatever original source was    
available. In practice though, interviewers used the checkpoint to describe   
what they actually did. In several offices with Master files, they worked only
with Poll books or some other primary source. Hence, variable 882032 reflects 
what the interviewer did, independently of how the office is organized: See   
variable 882131                                                               
                                                                              
              for information on which offices transcribe vote information    
into the registration master file.                                            
                                                                              
     1.   Voting information is NOT on registration records in this office    
          (only if a registration record for R was found). [Office 9 is coded 
          here, lists of voters and non-voters were used]                     
                                                                              
     2.   Alx is filled out and NO OTHER Registration record for a person     
          whose name and birthdate are a better match has been located. Three 
          cases contained data in Alx, in each case the study staff decided   
          that the record found did not belong to our respondent. All three   
          cases were then coded 5 in 882006.                                  
                                                                              
     3.   Alx is SKIPPED and no registration record has been found for this R 
                                                                              
     4.   We do have a registration record for this respondent AND vote       
          information is on registration records. [Offices 2, 6, 7, 20, 49,   
          56, 84, 101, 102, 104, 105, 106, 107, 112, 113 and 173 are coded    
          here. These offices send original registration records to the polls 
          where they are signed by the voters]                                
                                                                              
     0.   Inap, 3-5 in 882003 (not validated)                                 
                                                                              
==============================

NOTE FOR VARIABLES FOLLOWING (V882124-V882146):                               
                                                                              
The next several variables describe the sources the IWER used to ascertain    
whether or not a respondent voted. In this section we . distinguish between   
primary and secondary sources of vote information. PRIMARY sources are those. 
marked at the polls somehow on election day to show that a registrant has     
voted. SECONDARY sources are transcriptions made after election day on a      
master file. Most PRIMARY sources are poll books. They may be called "ledgers"
or "binders" or "checklists" or "dockets." By whatever name, they are the     
original lists of registrants for a particular polling place sent to the      
polls, and marked there by the voter and/or the election worker.  By          
definition, they are organized by precinct, and usually but not always they   
are in alphabetical order within each precinct book. Everyone who is in a poll
book is by definition registered, at least at the time of the election.       
                                                                              
==============================                                                
VAR 882124                                                                    
              COLUMNS 2071 - 2071                                             
              NUMERIC                                                         
                                                                              
              Did IWER use primary sources, such as poll books, or secondary  
             sources such as voter history master files, or both, to determine
             if a respondent for whom a registration record has been found    
             voted in the 1988 election?                                      
                                                                              
    REVALIDATION OF 1988 VOTE -                                               
    REVALIDATION PROCESS                                                      
                                                                              
     1.   Used poll books or other primary source                             
     5.   Used only secondary sources. -- go to 882126                        
                                                                              
     9.   NA: can't tell; vote records refused by office                      
                                                                              
     0.   Inap, 3-5 in 882003; 999 in 882005                                  
                                                                              
==============================                                                
VAR 882125                                                                    
              COLUMNS 2072 - 2072                                             
              NUMERIC                                                         
                                                                              
              INSOFAR AS WE CAN DETERMINE: for 1988, were these poll books    
used                                                                          
             as:                                                              
                                                                              
    REVALIDATION OF 1988 VOTE -                                               
    REVALIDATION PROCESS                                                      
                                                                              
     1.   Main source for determining vote history                            
     2.   Supplemental source, used only if master file didn't show R as      
          voting                                                              
     5.   Can't tell                                                          
                                                                              
     0.   Inap, 3-5 in 882003; 999 in 882005; 5, 9 in 882124 (POLL BOOKS NOT  
          USED)                                                               
                                                                              
==============================

    REVALIDATION OF 1988 VOTE -                                               
    REVALIDATION PROCESS                                                      
                                                                              
     01.   Every year or more frequently

VAR 882144                                                                    
              COLUMNS 2095 - 2095                                             
              NUMERIC                                                         
                                                                              
              Did Interviewer use Purged Registration Records.                
                                                                              
    REVALIDATION OF 1988 VOTE -                                               
    REVALIDATION PROCESS                                                      
                                                                              
This refers to records of persons formerly registered in this jurisdiction who
are no longer registered for some reason. Often, these records are kept in    
physically separate files -- pulled from the active registration files.       
                                                                              
     1.   Interviewer states that she used the purged file.                   
     5.   No positive evidence that the purged file was used by the IWER.     
                                                                              
     0.   Inap, 3-5 in 882003; 999 in 882005
